comments.author: Tori
comments.content: You can also find bulk citric acid in Indian grocery stores, often labeled 'Lemon Phool'. We always keep a jar of it handy, not just for fruit but for preventing artichoke hearts from browning, making soured milk, adjusting acidity in jams, etc. Sometimes you don't want a lemon flavor, and sometimes you just don't want to waste a perfectly good lemon!

comments.author: NanAppetit
comments.content: As usual, your photo looks delectable! Anyway, I recieved a tiny little blogger award and passed it on to my 15 favorite blogs including you! It's in my Rolo Cookies post from today. Thanks again for all you do!

comments.author: Katherine Martinelli
comments.content: I love this! My favorite is summertime around Union Square there are a ton of vendors selling cut up mango covered in this condiment. We're having a gorgeous mango season right now so this is perfect timing. Thanks!

comments.content: Which city's Union Square are we talking about? Cuz I want to hurry on down there right now!

comments.author: Katherine Martinelli
comments.content: Sorry - New York! It's one of my favorite treats :-)
